Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers had their best postseason performance in three years in Game 4, winning 8-0 to stave off elimination.
Manny Machado expressed that the Padres' hype tactics could influence a pitcher's performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Machado's toss to the dugout caused the Dodgers to send tape of the incident to Major League Baseball, with Roberts calling it, 'unsettling.'
Despite the fallout from Game 2, there weren't any heated moments in the Padres' 6-5 win in Game 3.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dodgers utilityman Max Muncy called out the Padres for hyping up their hits.
The Padres won Game 2, 10-2, with Jurickson Profar robbing Mookie Betts of a home run.
